title: Problem Overview
content: Erdős Problem #635: For A ⊆ {1,...,N} with b-a ≥ t implying (b-a) ∤ b, is |A| ≤ (1/2 + o_t(1))N? For t=1, max is ⌊(N+1)/2⌋. OPEN.
mathContext: A non-divisibility condition on differences constrains which pairs can coexist. The question is whether the density is always close to 1/2.

title: Non-Divisibility Condition and Extremal Function
content: IsNonDivisible(A, t): for a, b ∈ A with b-a ≥ t, (b-a) ∤ b. IsAdmissible(A, N, t): A ⊆ {1,...,N} and IsNonDivisible. f(N, t) = sSup of admissible set sizes.
mathContext: The extremal function f(N,t) measures the maximum size of a t-admissible subset of {1,...,N}.

title: Case t = 1: Odd Numbers
content: oddSet(N): odd numbers in {1,...,N}. oddSet_admissible (axiom): the odd set satisfies the condition. oddSet_card (axiom): |oddSet| = (N+1)/2. f_t1 (axiom): f(N,1) = (N+1)/2.
mathContext: Odd numbers are optimal for t=1: any difference from an odd number to another has an even component that prevents divisibility.

title: Case t = 2: Erdős Construction
content: f_t2_lower (axiom): f(N,2) ≥ N/2 + c·log(N). erdos_construction_t2 (axiom): explicit construction using odd numbers plus powers of 2.
mathContext: For t=2, Erdős showed one can exceed the N/2 barrier by a logarithmic amount, using odd numbers augmented with certain powers of 2.

title: Main Conjecture (OPEN)
content: ErdosConjecture635: ∀ ε > 0, ∀ t ≥ 1, ∃ N₀, ∀ N ≥ N₀, f(N,t) ≤ (1/2+ε)N. The density of admissible sets is always close to 1/2. erdos_635 (axiom).
mathContext: The o_t(1) notation means the error depends on t but vanishes as N → ∞ for fixed t.

title: Summary: OPEN
content: erdos_635_t1_solved (proved): f(N,1) = (N+1)/2 from f_t1. erdos_635_status (proved): True. Problem OPEN for general t.
mathContext: The t=1 case is completely resolved. The general conjecture remains open.
